Comments_List:
writing the paper is a fantastic exercise
i enjoyed the more theoretical, chatting through development topics of this class as a complement to metrics

I learned about many of the major papers in development economics, the structure of an RCT, and some of the challenges in intervening in developing countries. I also learned about the theory behind things like microfinance, and carrying out my own project helped me get an applied sense of how economic research is conducted.
Incredibly relevant insights on the present developing world. The problems and some of the inspiring practices employed to assess their magnitude and overcome them.

strengths - micro finance and RCTs are interesting, and i loved seeing TAvneet

weaknesses: some people got a little lost as to why we were doing insurance, some other more esoteric topics, so maybe it would be useful to more clearly signpost the the course material (we're doing this to get to that sort of thing)
A little too much focus on microfinance is a weakness in my view. But then my opinion could be prejudiced as I am not a big believer in it.
